result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Discharge Firearm/Vehicle-Bldg/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(3)(a)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  Victim witness surcharge to be paid from inmate wages.  Wages only not gifts.    If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Kelly

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark  Kelly in court in custody with attorney Theodore Bernard Kmiec Iii.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders on count 1:  3 years 6 months WSP and 5 years extended supervision; DOC collect $518 costs; DOC collect restitution, payable from inmate wages; 502 days sentence credit; eligible for Substance Abuse Program, not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Felon warnings advised.  Restitution Order to follow.
